title: Unnecessary Mountain
text:
Unnecessary Mountain, also called Mount Unnecessary, is a peak in the <a href="North%20Shore%20Mountains">North Shore Mountains</a> near <a href="Vancouver">Vancouver</a>, <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a> and a popular hiking destination. It is accessible via the <a href="Howe%20Sound%20Crest%20Trail">Howe Sound Crest Trail</a> and a direct route from <a href="Lions%20Bay%2C%20British%20Columbia">Lions Bay</a>.
The mountain is so named because of an "unnecessary" ascent over this mountain to reach <a href="The%20Lions%20%28peaks%29">The Lions</a>.
In December 2014, a <a href="rockslide">rockslide</a> killed 7-year-old Erin Kate Moore as she was hiking with a group on Unnecessary Mountain.
A second peak, also named Unnecessary Mountain, is located in <a href="Alberta">Alberta</a> northwest of the town of <a href="Pincher%20Creek%2C%20Alberta">Pincher Creek</a>.
